case_vignette: A 12-year-old female presents with hemorrhagic crusts on the lips and erosions of the oral, genital, and conjunctival mucosa for 2 days. According to the parents, there was a pneumonia outbreak at school. The patient also had a high fever and cough a week before the onset of cutaneous lesions. The parents deny any new medication and a history of allergies. The physical exam reveals no other skin findings.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
Hi, I have sores on my lips, inside my mouth, and my private area, as well as on the inside of my eyelids, and I started with these symptoms two days ago.
Have you experienced any fever, joint pain, or other systemic symptoms along with the sores?
I had a high fever and cough a week before these sores started.
Have you ever had similar symptoms in the past?
No, I have not had similar symptoms in the past.
Do you have a history of any other ongoing chronic illnesses or are you currently taking any medications?
No, I am not currently taking any medications and I don't have a history of chronic illnesses.
Is there any family history of skin issues or autoimmune diseases?
My parents deny any history of allergies or similar issues.
Final Diagnosis: Stevens-Johnson Syndrome.

trial_0.multiturn_mcq: **Final Diagnosis:** Mycoplasma pneumoniae-induced rash and mucositis
